intro: Pelargonium hirsutum var. carneum, commonly known as the beefsteak tomato, is a cultivar of the common geranium species. It is characterized by its large, fleshy fruits that can weigh up to 500 grams, with a deep red color and a meaty texture. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of 60–100 cm, with lobed, velvety leaves. It thrives in warm climates and requires full sun, well-drained soil, and consistent watering. This variety is widely cultivated for its culinary use, particularly in sauces and cooked dishes.
